examples.title:
In‑app
  card appears only when user taps Sharing ▸ Add Doctor;
  explains what data types (labs, vitals) will be shared and enables granular
  toggles.
examples.use_case:
Health‑record
  sharing between patients and healthcare providers.
examples.why_selected:
Demonstrates
  explicit, context‑triggered consent for highly sensitive health data
  (GDPR Art. 9).
examples.pbd_alignment:
Proactive, Privacy
  as default, Respect for user privacy
examples.nielsen_heuristics:
User control
  & freedom; Match between system & real world

examples.title:
Overlay
  appears when user first starts camera‑based measurement:
  explains sensitive biometrics, light/heart‑rate analysis, local processing.
  “Got it / Allow Camera” options.
examples.use_case:
Fitness
  apps capturing physiological signals via camera.
examples.why_selected:
Shows sensor‑specific,
  just‑in‑time consent with privacy explanation for raw bio‑signals.

examples.title:
Modal
  sheet appears when user taps Attach ▸ Location:
  duration slider (15 min/1 hr/8 hr) + encryption notice. Can stop sharing
  anytime.
examples.why_selected:
Exemplifies
  time‑bounded, revocable consent for continuous sensitive location.
examples.nielsen_heuristics:
Flexibility
  & efficiency; Visibility of system status

examples.company:
Microsoft
  Entra Verified ID - Credential Sharing Prompt
examples.title:
When
  scanning a QR code, user sees a credential‑preview card listing each claim
  (legal name, DOB) and tap Share to send only selected claims.
examples.use_case:
Digital
  identity wallets exchanging verifiable credentials.
examples.why_selected:
Fine‑grained
  consent for sensitive identity data supports data minimization.
examples.nielsen_heuristics:
Recognition
  rather than recall; Consistency & standards

examples.title:
Voluntary,
  skip‑able overlay offered when editing profile; explains usage for diversity
  analytics, not public, can remove anytime.
examples.use_case:
Collecting
  race/ethnicity, gender‑identity—sensitive data under EU/US laws.
examples.why_selected:
Provides
  contextual explanation, voluntariness, and easy withdrawal.
examples.pbd_alignment:
Respect
  for user privacy, Visibility & transparency
examples.nielsen_heuristics:
Help
  users recognize, diagnose, recover; Minimalist design
